comments.body: Crafting a ring + a potion of invisibility gives a Ring of Power.  Turns the bearer invisible when held in either the right or left hand.  Must have!  My precious!
Ice armor prevents sliding on ice.
I think magic should only have an effect in this dimension in order to contain potential problems in the overworld.

I don't think the rings should be able to be combined with potions.  Although that would be a fun reference. x3

That might be another option for ice armor.  But how often do you actually want to not slide on ice?  Most of the time people are making use of ice's slippery properties intentionally.

If the magic only works in this dimension, then there would be pretty much no reason to do the work to unlock it.  I definitely agree that if it's a problem, the offensive and defensive spells could have reduced effectiveness against players and maybe mobs from other dimensions.  But the passive ones are designed to just be generally useful.
Reduced would be good.  That way it would still be useful, but not too op.
How do you come up with this stuff? It’s great! I totally agree!

WindingTheRopes, trust me, this took at least a month to make.  I also spent a lot of time talking about it with a friend.  It's amazing what talking about an idea can do.  It firms up some things that were vague and the different perspective can bring in things you would never have thought of. =3
bilbo i just knew u were going to come up with the Ruling Ring...

These are very cool ideas, though I think the same things could be accomplished using the existing magic system in a different way. A lot of the effects described are similar to potion effects. So while I would love for the magic system to expand, and agree with some of your ideas, I think that adding to the existing potion system would be better than implementing these ideas. P. S., I love your glamour idea!
Fire sword could light them up with mythos fire a it does 3 damage per second that should fix it right???
Maybe you could make certain mobs immune to certain types of magic? e.g. Strays are immune to ice-type magic, Blazes are immune to fire type magic, etc
it will make Minecraft mods much better
no
why? what purpose would it have?
No.  They would just burn.
You are already immortal, having endless rebirths. Have the courage to risk at least items and experience.

Losing your items and getting back your items by either going back to where you died while surviving or making new items is a part of the game. If you aren't willing to sacrifice the time to do it, if you turn on keep inventory, then you're just skipping an important part of the game. If you didn't get punished for dying by losing items, dying wouldn't be meaningful. By avoiding this meaningful punishment, you're basically cheating.
In java edition, this is not a cheat, as well as turning phantoms off.
It's a cheat because the game wouldn't be as much of a challenge otherwise. Having to work to reclaim stuff is part of the authentic experience.

for the people saying you have to have this is part of the challenge, in a game mode where you have the option of Peaceful with no enemies and not having to eat, i agree with OP that this should also be another option alongside things like the free map and bonus chest, rather than a cheat.

other games (and even Java) allow you to choose your own death punishment, and it helps make the game more relaxing, which is what some people (including myself, sometimes) are looking for, without being called cheaters.

as someone who stuff their inventory to the brim, with shulkers, sometimes i just wanna go home after a mining trip and keep all my stuff. if we have peaceful, why not this? it sucks never getting advancements n stuff just bc of this

If you want to make the game easier, then that's fine, turn on cheats. What's happening here is that you don't want to play the game as intended, but you also want the advantages of playing the game as intended. That's just stupid. Either get good, and play as intended, or accept that you don't get advancements.

This would not require any new mechanics. All gameplay mechanics are ALREADY implemented here, no new items would be required, no new functions, or routines, other than "if XP level is above 3, allow this and drain XP to zero"

Who thinks about how the happy ghost would feel?

Personally, I'm doing all the achievements in the game in Bedrock, but that achievement, man, I couldn't.

Unless what they drop when they die is something super powerful.
(Or if the happy ghost leaves you a letter saying, "Why did you do this to me?" (Something like "Don't kill the dolphins, monster," something that makes you question whether it was worth killing that entity that is pure happiness, just for an achievement.)

Anyway, it seems like a Machiavellian achievement to me.

You know something a supervillain would do?

I agree! I think Quartz, Calcite and Amethyst feel a little lacking wrt block types, Quartz especially with it missing walls or slab varieties for the chiseled and pillar quartz.

I also think it'd be nice to add the wall/fence/slab options for wood (walls) and resource blocks like iron gold diamond

Yes, that would be a really cool idea! I hope you get thorugh!

A larger size of drinkable potions that let you reach all the way to level 4 (I think that's the level where Instant health gives 10 hearts)? I wouldn't mind that. Though it should have some caveats:

1 - It takes ~60% longer to drink.

2 - instead of being brewed it should be made by putting normal potions into a cauldron and scooping them out with the large potions same as water with a bucket.

3 - obtaining these potions does not unlock the Local Brewery advancement.

Wither Skeletons drop their skulls naturally, with Looting enchantment increasing the chance the skull will drop. You don't have to kill them with a Charged Creeper. I do think it would be cool if pigmen could barter all types of skull though. Imagine a pigman bartering a Piglin Head!

It would make sense. The canon reason Piglins have string they can barter is because they can barter is cause they kill Striders and we can watch Piglins kill wither skeletons, having wither skeleton drops in their loot table would be logical. Would be super rare though; possibly the rarest thing they trade.

Yes but thats already a feature heres how you do it

Bedrock (console, phone, ect)

/gamemode <mode> <player> 

s = survival, sp = spectator, c = creative, a = adventure or type out each word

Java (PC)

/gamemode <gamemode> <target>

  • <gamemode>: Specifies the desired gamemode. It can be one of the following:

    • survival or 0: Survival mode

    • creative or 1: Creative mode

    • adventure or 2: Adventure mode

    • spectator or 3: Spectator mode
